Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphones produce crystal clear sound over an incredible range. Light weight, comfortable and fold compactly. I would be hard pressed to imagine better headphones at this price. I can't think of a single con.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: MDRV6 - Sony Studio Monitor Series Black Headphones review
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use,Lightweight,Clear Sound,Compact,Versatile
Great Cans. Great insulation from environmental noise, impecable highs and clear mid range... extremely clear indeed. Swivel arms provide for space saving

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: As soon as I saw the box I was impressed. [...] very inviting. Especially with the gold box and red lining. When I opened the box and held the headphones I was very impressed with the build. And I plugged it into my soundboard and was blown away with the warm bass and awesome mid tones and highs. Definitely recommend this product!.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Amazing Sound, So Glad I Bought These!!
Item.Review: I have been looking around for a good set of over the ear headphones to use in my office and for use on long plane rides, (been using earbuds for the compact quality, but they are just not comfortable for me). I also love music and have a good ear for the fullness and range of sound in the music that I listen to. I am always very aware of the quality of the headphones or speakers while listening. There were three things that I wanted in my purchase: I wanted headphones that were comfortable, sounded AMAZING, and were not too expensive. I found the Sony MDR-V6 after doing online research and was impressed with most of what was said about them, but there were a few negative reviews that made me doubtful... based on the much larger volume of popular opinion and the very nice price, I cho ... se to order these. The MDR-V6 have very comfortable ear pads and felt great on my last two 11 hour flights. They were a great price and I would honestly consider buying another pair to keep stored for one day. They also have AMAZING sound! The music is rich and full as you would expect, but everything is also clear and pure in all ranges, low through high. They are capable of handling powerful bass it comes through without sounding muddy. Contrary to some reviews that I have read, the Sony MDR-V6 has wonderful bass in large amounts. I think the intended use is for superior sound clarity and reproduction as opposed to overwhelming thumping bass, so that may be where the bass sufficient discrepancy comes in for some. The only drawback for my needs is that the cord is just a bit too be perfectly comfortable on a plane. I personally do not mind, but I could see where others may if this is one intended use. The style is more classic than modern hi-tech if that is a concern, (I like the classic style). To make a long story short, (too late): Very comfortable, AMAZING sound quality that I would expect from headphones much more expensive, and the price was very nice. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These things deserve their good reputation. For a very reasonable price they deliver very good sound, and much better than anything else I heard anywhere near the money. Clean neutral sound that is not thin or harsh. No overboosted bass. Good neutral tonal balance and the ability to handle power without the sound falling apart. Long cord not the best for portability.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphones are a good value for quality and sound. The sound is clear with accurate range from lows to highs. Only issue for me is that my ears seem to be larger than normal and for extended use they get uncomfortable, even with the deluxe add on ear pads. The sound quality is not audiophile, but for the price I'm not complaining. I use my Stax for that. I use these mostly for computer and iPod use and when I occasionally fly.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Haven't used them a lot yet but they've been great. I was a little upset at the padding on them, they fell off immediately when I took them out of the bad, the ear padding. I was like great I can already see I'm going to have to deal with this for a long time. They've stayed on well since then. The sound canceling is amazing for as small as the padding is. Great sound for the price as well. It's great that it's compact, but it also makes the design feel a little flimsy.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Perceived Construction Quality,Short Warranty,Sound Quality
Cons: Died After A Few Months. Tight Fit And Uncomfortable
After reading so many glowing reviews, I jumped on the bandwagon. The sound quality is definitely the product's strong point, though if you primarily listen to MP3s, and they were not encoded in the best manner possible, this headset will punish you for it with mediocre sound.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I absolutely love the clarity and detail of the sounds that I get from this headphone. The headphone is perfect for recording and editing audio. If something happens to it, I will buy it again :)

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I have owned my MDR-V6 headphones for 20 years now and have never heard anything better! Deep, rich bass with crisp clean highs and everything in between. I listen to quite a range of music and these work for everything.Since purchasing them I've only had to replace the ear-pads twice. Some feel this is a negative, but considering the superb sound quality, I will gladly buy new pads when needed. I really felt relieved that just last week I needed the second set and they were still available. I ordered the original style from Sony (not expensive either, just $5.95 each). I hope that Sony or another vendor has replacement pads available in another 20 years because for as long as the MDR-V6's work, I will not replace them.I would definitely recommend them to others. Seeing them still a ... vailable online, I may buy another pair (or two) to have as spares.Money well spent! (Almost [$] in 1988 on a college students budget ) expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Best deep and full bass! Sooo worth it!
Item.Review: As an audiophile, I deeply enjoy all of the subtle things about music many people look past. The frequency response has to be low for good bass however the mids have to be clear and the treble has to be well defined. The MDR-V6s have it all, perfectly balanced and rich sound. On top of that B&H has the best price on the web!

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Better sound than hd280 and others
Item.Review: These cans sound insanely good, I really loved my hd280 pros but they are not as well made, do not feel as comfy and do not reproduce sound and music as accurately as these cans do. On top of all that, these v6s are TANKS, I have thrown them, traveled with them and they cannot be killed. Ear pads wear off and are hard to put on but thats a minor thing. Great bass impact and extension, great mids.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: MDRV6 - Sony Studio Monitor Series Black Headphones review
Item.Review:
Pros: Bass,Good Value,Great Sound
I'm no specialist, and I don't work professionally in the music field. I bought these headphones to listen to Holosync CDs as the deeper ranges are needed; however, I can't quit listening to my music with these! I'm hearing things I've never heard before...richer, deeper bass, more notes and sounds in recordings. It's like having the artist singing in your ear. When my husband and daughter listened to them, they wanted a pair; so, I've since ordered two more pairs. With an intro coupon, I paid[$] for these which was a great deal [...]. I know [...] had them for a hair more as well. These are a FABULOUS set of headphones.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Bad for the first bit, amazing afterward
Item.Review: When I first heard these I thought they were terrible, so I decided to break them in by playing music on it on moderate volume for about 25 hours. The sound changed drastically over the course of this time--Very clear highs and great punchy lows! The only thing I dislike is the comfort, I can't wear them for longer than a couple of hours. But then again, I'm comparing these to the Sennheiser HD650's.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I recently got these headphones the sound quality is great the best headphones I ever bought and used. The bass and subtle voices and instruments come through clearly. Unlike anything I have heard before. A real good buy.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I was nervous about buying headphones at this price since I have been breaking my cheap ones like crazy, but after receiving them there are now worries. After I broke them in by letting them play away for a couple days to some classical music these bad boys became stellar in sound. Yes, they are big headphones, but obviously you are not here to buy junk ear buds, you actually want to listen to all the instruments, and believe me they let you listen to all the minuscule precious noises that are supposed to be there. The only negative I have is with the chord that is coiled and shortens the length, but really adds to the weight. I have to pay a lot of attention to it as it slides off of my lap and I can feel the weight on my head immediately, but you figure out ways to deal.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I'm completely surprised by these headphones. I've been reading a lot of reviews before actually making this purchase. It's a surprise how old or really how long Sony has been making these particular headphones. It reproduces great bass and excellent highs. I was watching a movie on my PS3 while they were connected to my A/V receiver and I could hear sounds that I never noticed before. The coiled wire is awesome too because it actually kind of stays out of your way. I would HIGHLY recommend these especially if you don't want to spend over $100 on a great pair of headphones. Also B&H was the lowest price out of all the rest [...]

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Best value in closed phones available.
Item.Review: If sound isolation is what you need,these will be hard to beat at any price; Open cans is another story. I remember when these were the Best Buy in Consumer Reports over 2 decades ago(I am 63 years old). My first pair I sold, in working condition, after a mere 17 years. Like most Pleather covered earpads, on many other brands, these too will require replacement every 2-3 years or so. The frequency graphs/charts on [@] show these still to be among the best of the closed and full sized headphones, at a truly bargain price. B&H has, as usual, the best price, in my research. You won't be disappointed.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: A perfect mix of comfort and quality
Item.Review: I bought my first MDR-V6 in 2000 and bought a new pair in 2008 (because I broke the old ones, so note they did not stop working on their own). I've never had better studio headphones of quality that are this comfortable. I once wore my pair for 12 hours straight, and apart from having to air out my ears on occasion there was no discomfort whatsoever. The sound quality is great - it handles pretty high levels of bass and amplification without any feedback. The portability is good, it comes with its own travel bag and compacts neatly. The cord looks small but since it is coiled it can stretch pretty far. The only minor inconvenience to be had here is the coating on the earpads can wear down and shed/peel after you've had them for 3-4 years. This however doesn't affect comfort at all. ... When I first bought these they were about $110 new. It was worth every penny back then, but now that they've fallen to almost half that price, they are absolutely the best headphones I can recommend. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These Headphones have worked great for me. The ear cups seal outside noise out and are comfortable as they do so. They produce excellent highs and bass has to be extremely low to notice any distortion. I love the way that the fold up for easy carry. They are built like a tank. The only trade off is that they are not the lightest headphones you will put on.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use this produce in Shooting and Directing Education videos for a university. Also, used in Edit room for post-production. These work really well, and come in nice packaging and are made excellently well. These sound great, fit my ears very well, and even block out enough noise from everywhere else to suit my needs. I bought these because we already owned the MDR-7506's, and these are almost exactly the same, with the gold tip headphone jack as the exception.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I have purchased 3 of these over the years. I think they are the best value out there for studio quality headphones. They are very comfortable, even after long periods of time. They're great for reducing peripheral noise, and they sound great. Nice fat lows and crisp, clean highs. There are more expensive headphones out there, but in my opinion, you don't get a whole lot more for your money. The only drawback is that after lots of use, the ear pads wear out and must be replaced.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Owned a pair since 1978 (junior year in college): though the earplugs are worn, still working, same great sound as Day 1. Excellent sound, high fidelity, very comfortable. Probably the best VALUE one can find. Sounds better than the MDR 7506 (also very good sound, similar physical design/comfort) probably due to wider frequency response. I'm surprised it is still available after all these years! Will buy another one just in case....

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Everyone should know these are the industry standard headphones and they hold true to that name. Extremely comfortable for my egg shaped head, nice thick cable, and the sound is great! The coil on the cable doesn't start until about 2 feet down from the headphone ear so there is not as much weight hanging off your head. Good engineering. Well worth money.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use them at my desk, on the go (iPhone) and for DJing. Really impressive range of sound, good solid bass. I was pleased with how much sound is blocked out by the full-ear covers. Cable is slightly cumbersome when you're storing it in your pocket, the coils take up considerable space. Great purchase!

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: They are good but not that good. It doesn't isolate anything. There's little outside sound reduction and they aren't as loud as my Senheiser HD 202 II for $25 and not as sleek. In a few weeks the cushioning covering unravelled like it was glued together with scotch tape The sound quality wasn't much better. I don't understand the hype on these things. They are quiet, don't block much sound, and the cushion covering came apart in no time. But the box was beautiful.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use this set for music and gaming on my desktop. It gives me decent sound isolation and provides a full range of sounds. The head band is a little big for me,but that may just be because my head is smaller.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I ordered these headphones to replace my old MDR-V4 headphones, which still sound great but are starting to fall apart. The MDR-V6 headphones sound just as good with better midrange response. I am very satisfied with this purchase.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Good for editing or just listening to high fidelity recordings. The power required to drive these phones and the physical weight of them are not suitable for small MP3 players and bus-ride listening. V6's are very precise and don't get muddy during complexly layered tracks. Frequency response is relatively flat down to 30 Hz, with no noticeable coloration. The cord is long and beefy with the strongest 1/8 plug I've ever seen. As with most Sony's, the folding mechanism and ear foam appear to be the weakness... but I expect alot of use from these. Can't beat the SQ and build quality, even at twice the price.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Still breaking them in but sound is very flat. Good monitoring headphones and will need some time to break in. Compared to my Sennheiser hd280 they seem to be less heavy in the mid bass and treble is a lot more neutral. For the price you cannot go wrong. Don't isolate as well as the Senns hd280.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Before I bought these, I went to a local pro-audio shop to listen to products in my price range (which I highly suggest you do). Between the Senn 555's, AT M50's, and AKG K240's, these were my favorite. I use them for work, casual listening, and light gaming. They are less enjoyable for the later two because of the analyticity, but accuracy is one of the reasons I bought these. They are comfortable, durable, and sound fantastic. I will say this though: Before they're broken in, they are undoubtedly harsh. Lowering things in the 2 kHz range for the first week or so will help you survive it, and you'll be glad you did; these are some rockin' cans.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Having tried all of B&H's headphones, I chose this one for its balance of price and sound. I am most pleased with how good music flows into my ears from these headphones. I am well happy with this choice. The only drawback is the cord which is rather heavy and sometimes dangles over the keyboard. But that's more a matter of where the headphones go on my computer desk than anything else.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: The MDR-V6s are lightweight with fantastic studio sound. The bass is also fantastic and will undoubtedly satisfy any moderate bass lover. These headphones are worth every dollar!

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I am a composer and producer, so having a great pair of headphones is important to my work and also for just listening for pleasure. These Sony headphones are a great addition to any studio setup. And they make your Ipod or IPhone one hundred times better. There is a nice range of bass and treble, and I find them to be very pleasing and accurate. And they fold nicely in the bag for storage and transporting.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I owned this same model of headphones in the late 1980s. They stood head and shoulders above the rest in their price range at the time. I wish I still had those headphones, because I'd like to compare them to the new ones I recently bought. When I listen to the new ones, they seem somewhat flat compared to what I remember. However, it's possible that the sources I'm using for listening are underpowered. Back in the late 80s, I owned the top-of-the-line Onkyo CD player, which is what I used for all my headphone listening. Today, I use my laptop or my iPod. I realize the songs purchased through iTunes have lossy compression, but even my lossless transfers from CD don't sound as good as I had expected. For this reason, I docked one star. Then again, I was in my late teens when I ha ... d these before, so it's entirely possible that my hearing has degraded in the interim and I'm not being entirely fair. I still prefer these by far to JBuds and other highly rated headphones I've tried. I highly recommend changing the earpads to the Beyerdynamic 250/280 replacement cushions. The Sony pads make my ears feel hot within 10 minutes. The Beyerdynamic pads allow me to wear my phones for well over an hour with no problem. I use these at work, and they do a great job of reducing distraction from conversations in surrounding cubicles. If I'm listening to music at moderate levels, then nearby conversations are reduced to indistinct background noise which doesn't distract. At loud music levels, I'm unlikely to hear much from the outside world at all. So even if these headphones are slightly less than what I remember, they're still a very good value. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Read previous reviews. Using primarily to listen to music loaded on iPad and works well for that. Good bass. Fits my head well. More comfortable than ear buds for me. Thought cord might be too long, but have found it's OK. like storage pouch. Pleased with my purchase. Looking forward to using this on trip in airports/on planes next month. B&H great as usual for price, [...] etc.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These are my favorite headphones I've ever owned! They sound great! I've read some reviews saying the only downside is that they can be uncomfortable, but they fit me perfect. Buy them, you won't regret it.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These have been great for on-set recording, audio post and basic music-listening. Provide a great range of sound and are probably the best you can get for the price.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: For the money, this is a very good quality and comfortable headphones. I use it to hear music in its entirety. Music source is important as it does give a LOT of detail. Coil style cord is convenient. Beautiful packaging. I would like the foam to be a little more beefy because after extended use it sometimes irritates the rim of my ears. Good thing they are available to purchase. There may be better headphones out but for this price is a very good value.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These cans sound great with my first generation Zune. Everything is crisp and clear, the sound quality is just amazing! I am a fan of bass and although its not earth shattering bass, it's more than enough and does not sound distorted at all. As far as I can tell there really are no cons to this product although they do squeeze your head a little bit (I wear size 7 1/4 fitted baseball hats just to give you an idea of the size of my head). The ear pads are quite comfortable though which helps, however be aware they are quite tight, and it becomes quite noticeable after prolonged use. The telephone cord is also something that some might not like, however, I don't mind it at all. I like how the cord retracts a bit rather than having a long straight wire running 10 ft., its a bit less awkward. ... Other than the tightness, they are the best headphones I've ever owned! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use these headphones for personal use like listening to music and also monitoring mixes and recording. These are great headphones. These are a favorite of some of the old-school media guys I know. They are so comfortable and they sound great. Wonderful value.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great aural frequency response; Incredible sound quality; Quality sound reproduction; Great audio frequency range
Cons: bulky
This is my first professional grade of headphones. However, I have used nice headphones at work and I can say that these are one of the best for the price that they sell for. It comes with a carrying bag that you can transport the headphones without getting them all messed up and they fold pretty messed up. It has great audio frequency range and amazing sound quality. I use these with recording music and also for listening on my ipod as it works to drown outside noise as well.
I researched quite a bit and after seeing reviews decided on this one and I have not been disappointed. However the foam part has come off of one of the ears a few ... times and it's a pain to get it back on but you can get it on. It may have in part have to do with my husband borrowing them to listen to his music on the laptop and not taking proper care of them. They are a little bulky but most are that you want to cover your whole ear. Great product! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use this product in my video production to ensure a great audio track. I can hear an vast range of sounds which allows me to detect unwanted background noise on the video. I can always count on great audio reproduction with these headphones. I would recommend this product for anyone in the video business.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Light weight; Folding design for easier storage; Great aural frequency response; Incredible sound quality
Cons: None
The first time I used these headphones I just couldn't put them down because the sound was so amazing. These are a far cry from the normal earphones I use and for those music lovers out there, it is definitely worth the hefty price tag. With these headphones, you can hear crisp details in the music you normally would have paid no attention to and it makes everything sound so much better. The leather is comfy, it folds easily and it doesn't heat up even if you keep them on for a few hours. It's long cord is also convenient for those that like to swivel around in their chairs, but kind of inconvenient to carry around.
To put it simply, it makes bland ... music sound at least decent. These aren't noise cancelling headphones, but they do filter out a lot of noise. And they're very durable; I've tossed them on the bed, floor, against the wall, etc. many times but it's still as amazing as it was when I first bought it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I got these headphones for the home-recording purpose. These headphones perform perfect flat sound, not exaggerated. And these are much cheaper than other monitoring headphones. I can say these are the best headphones under [$], possibly even under [$] or [$].I recommend these headphones for indoor.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: When this product was first released in the 80's a videographer/drummer friend brought a pair over for a session and I immediately went out and got myself a pair. I still have those and this year gave my son a set for his 23rd birthday. The gift was a hit. He has been getting serious about sound and wanted something like this. He loves them as much as I do. These are earphones you can use for everything, and you will be happy with them forever! The ear cushions are slightly fragile, but, unlike when they were newer, replacements no longer cost an arm and a leg. Get some MDR-V6's (and peel the digital stickers off them). You will have found the sound you have been looking for.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Awesome!Can't believe I got them for $ US at B&H. Impressive sound quality, sounds better than a lot of more expensive headphones. I now understand why they are considered a studio standard. I'd add, this is a gold standard for any studio :)I use them with my Korg Kronos keyboard, with my computer to listen to music and in my studio. The sound will improve with use and reach its peak after 100hours of usage, approximatively.Only cons : wires near the headcuffs are exposed, but I heard people could keep them in good shape for 10+ yrs.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Still Satisfied after 14 years of DJing!
Item.Review: I have been DJing for 14 years and have grown attached to my MDR-V6s. I originally heard about these headphones through word of mouth advertising. I purchased these same headphones for my mom who happened to be deaf in one ear and she can actually hear these headphones through both ears because she is able to pick up the vibrations that headphones put on the back of her deaf ear. The insulation is very comfortable, and the headphones can get impressively loud with crystal clear audio precision. 2 very enthusiastic thumbs up.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Best all around headphone you can buy, especially for the price.. Theres a reason sony has kept this studio headphone around for over more than a decade and thats because it works!! Forget the Gimmicks of todays marketing, go with the old of tried and true.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I have been using these phones for at least 20 years. I do voiceovers for a living and DJ occasionally. They are super clear, have just the right amount of bass. To me, they make music sound the way it is supposed to sound. You can pay more for a set of cans but why? If you don't need in-ear monitoring, these are your choice.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These are great sounding decently priced headphones. I can't imagine paying any more or any less for another product. I use them mostly for listening to interviews for which they are fantastic.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I searched and searched for a headset and thought I would never be happy, until I remembered these beauties. I purchased quite a few headsets already including Bose and Beats and neither live up to the comfort and sound quality of the Sony MDR-v6! - which cost a third less by the way. I had these many years ago but over time and wear, moved on to newer sets, only to return finding nothing that could match up. The only con I have is the coiled wire, but have learner to appreciate it since I can plug them into my computer and walk about freely without having to wrap them back up when I walk back. CONCLUSION: FOR THE MONEY, CAN'T BE BEAT !!! [...] Over a month now with the VR6 and no issues.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I tried the more expensive models from various brand names and could not tell a difference among them. I was very pleased with the clarity and well balanced sound of the Sony MDR-V6. Will paying three times as much produce a better experience? Probably, but I am more than pleased with these. Try them and see for yourself.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Excellent sound quality. Comfortable. The bass is a little lower than most consumer headphones I have owned, which as a personal preference may be less desirable. One thing that can be a little annoying is the headphones are prone to folding up on themselves when you take them off, and don't rest well around your neck. But it's really not much of an issue, and I really like the fact they fold up so I'm happy to take a minor negative.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I was a big fan of the 7509's but then Sony decided to improve them and released the 7509HD that sound thin and aren't as comfortable. The V6, while not as smooth as the original 7509's are very decent headphones. The bottom end is big but not boomy and the top is nice and airy without sounding harsh. They are very comfortable. The circumaural ear pads provide excellent isolation. I use them for tracking, editing and as monitors for my portable rig. Over all a great headphone for a fraction of the price of the 7509's.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I got these for my wife to listen to her music. I did alot of research to make sure I was getting something that was sturdy and had good frequency range. They sound amazing, and are incredibly conforable. I will definately be getting a second pair for myself to use for mixing.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Use these for Location Sound Recording. Very comfortable on your ears - you can barely notice them. Wish they blocked out a little more sound, but overall still pretty good. Everything sounds full and clear. Comes with a little pouch and can be folded up for easier transport.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I bought these for my son, age 15, I think they are better than popular headphones that are 3 times the cost, which my daughter owns. They were recommended by a DJ friend, they are great -- and hip enough to wear in public.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Great Sounding Comfortable Headphones!! They are very sturdy and well made. It is impressive how much surrounding sound they cut out! Very Clear full range sound spectrum! Over all I am very impressed with these and would definitely purchase them again.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use these headphones to listen to classical music, which means that the quality and detail of the sound are incredibly important as is volume. These phones more than meet my expectations for all of these requirements.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Fantastic sound for the price. Unfortunately I had a little rattling in the left cup when the music hit a range of bass, but not a deal-breaker. Great for music (what they're built for), soundstage is not so great for gaming - I could hear more, but I couldn't really hear where. Comfort is what really bothered me out of box... could only wear them for 20 min at a time. They're a little more worn-in now though so not too bad. Definitely thinking about getting the Beyerdynamic pads though.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These are great headphones. These are probably best for monitoring audio as opposed to casual music listening as these let you hear everything. I use them for monitoring audio while filmmaking or shooting events and for audio editing. The folding design is great for storage and transport and they feel very well built. The cord is a good length. I know of people who have had these for 20 years and they are still going. I expect to get quite a few years out of mine as well.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use these primarily for watching television/DVDs, because partial hearing loss makes headphones better than speakers. Had numerous sets of Sennheisers, but they were flimsy, esp. in the cable, and did not last long. These seem much more robust than the Sennheisers. First pair of Sonys held up well for 2 years (avg. life of Sennheisers), but were accidentally destroyed. Sound quality is comparable (to my damaged ears) between the two brands, but Sony is louder, perhaps because of over the ear, rather than on-ear design. Ears can get a bit warm with extended use.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Not just for the Pro audio folks
Item.Review: As an Amateur Radio operator these headphones are outstanding. They are light weight, cover the ear comfortably, and sound amazing! The coiled cord has plenty of length. The only downside are the ear pads wearing out. Now they will last for years but be aware they will tear where they attach to the ear piece over time. You can purchase replacements so don't let this stop you from buying these headphones. These are similar to the MDR-7506 and they are NOT similar to the MDR-V600....The MDR-V600 is a poor unit and only buy the MDR-V6 or the pro audio MDR7506.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I bought this headphones for studio use. I was looking for an alternative solution for tracking choirs and orchestras in my studio. We generally use 7506 , Sennheiser hd 280 and Akg 271, but this MDRV6 heaphones has great sound compared to 7506 and they are cheaper. I will buy more of course.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Product at a great price
Item.Review: If you are looking for a great set of headphones for the money, the Sony MDR V6 are a good choice. I won't ramble on about all the technical jargon, there are many reviewers far more knowledgeable than I on this site to do that. I bought these for personal use around home, with computers, I Touch, etc. and simply put,they sound great to my ears! I'm sure that you can spend much, much, more for headphones and they will outshine these. But the sound quality of the MDR V6s comes at a price that is far below what you will have to pay to achieve the same quality of sound with other brands. Buy them, you WILL be pleased with them!

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I have been using these connected to my PC tower at work as well as my iPod. The cord is really long so i wouldn't recommend walking around with them. So far they seem to bring out different tones I had not noticed previously when using a cheap pair of Koss headphones. These do not block out all outside noise but they definitely muffle the outside world a bit. I needed something comfortable for earing throughout much of the day at work, listening to music and podcasts. These seem to fit the bill so far and are fairly highly regarded by headphone enthusiasts on various forums. I'm happy with them and the sound they produce although I do not consider myself to be an expert.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphones are wonderful and offer crisp clear sound. They are just as good as any noise cancelling headphones, since they fit around the ear and drown out outside noise during use. The only draw-back, is that they are a little heavy on the ears.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Wow; i would like to start listing all of the many pluses about these headphones but they've already been stated in previous reviews. Basically; they sound great and are extremely comfortable not to mention a great value. Apparently these headphones have been so good that they've been around for about 20 years (i'm sure the technology has changed inside them though). If you can afford these, then buy them and you wont regret it.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: As a film maker I need well made equipment that does its job. And I want things that last and that I can depend on,which is certainly trues with these headphones.They are solid,collapsible,and there isn't a part that will snap,crack,or twist off. There are many more expensive headphones but few offer the sound quality at this price. Its a home run piece of equipment that can just keep going.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I've also owned a pair of MDR-7506s for almost 10 years and these v6s seem to have just as clean with a flatter frequency response, which I prefer. The build quality is solid and it comfortable with a good seal from exterior noise. The only improvement I'd like on all Sony headphones would be a shorter, or detachable cable like some other brands. The ability to change the cord length would be awesome.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Don't Make the Same mistake that I did!!
Item.Review: These were the fourth headphones I purchased in a string of headphones purchased over the last year. I bought the Sennheiser HD280's based on reviews and while they were bright and had a nice transparent quality to them, they lacked fullness and punch on the lower end. I found that I needed to listen to them louder than usual to get that full sound that I wanted. Bought a bluetooth stereo set that was not worth the packaging that it came in. Bought ear bud types that piped everything in without having any spatial qualities and left my head numb. Then I was at my brother's studio (lifelong recording artist) and had a listen to his V6's and was absolutely stoked on just how full and rich the sound was over the entire spectrum at mid and lower volume levels. The bass is balanced and deep ... without any boominess. I am equally amazed at the lack of distortion as you crank it up. Before I ran out and bought these, I went and listened to several other models to as high as $200 just to be sure. These kicked 'em all in the pants. Now I own these and have that silly grin on my face as I rock out. Buy these, you will be very happy. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I bought these headphones to replace my uncomfortable Sony MDR-V150's. These headphones are used for late night listening or when my wife doesn't want me playing my home stereo. They sound great and are easy to listen to for long periods of time without discomfort. I have had open back Sennheisser's in the past but I much prefer a closed back design. It was either the Sony MDR-V6 or Sennheisser HD-280. Because of my past experience with both brands I chose the Sony's. Very satisfied with my decision. Great for late night trance music listening.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I now own three pairs of these. Using 2 on corporate video shoots and one in the studio. They are super-durable, fold up small and produce quality sound. Great value.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: They have been making these headphones for years. For good reasons, they don't cost an arm and leg and they work great, sound good, well built. I use mostly on my guitar effects and in the studio. Check the prices and you will see B & H has the best price on these headphones, you will find!!!!

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: After 20 years they still sounded great
Item.Review: I first bought a Sony MDR-V6 about 20years ago because of a Consumers Report article .I had to replace the ear pads about 4 years ago,although they still sounded great.One night in the dark I stepped on them and broke the head set I didn't even give it a second thought about what to get as a replacement(another MDR-V6) . By the way they originally cost me twice as much. I think they are a great deal.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I am a musician-songwriter traveling away from home, I needed reliable headphones to review mixes and my engineer suggested the Sony MDR-V6 I did not want to spend a pile of money as I do have high fidelity headphones at my studio. These headphones fill the bill. Great sound quality, neutral EQ, well built and reliable. So far nothing not great about them I will keep these around for sure at the studio.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphones are a real all around great performer. They are very comfortable. If you are listening to hours of music for relaxation or a movie late at night, they will not wear you out. I have purchased other expensive noise canceling headphones which were quite a discomfort overall. The sound quality is magnificent, truly earns its category rating of studio monitor. B&H's price makes it even a better bargain. They retail almost every where else for over [$].

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: The Sony MDR-V6 Headphones are excellent in sound quality and durability. I use mine for ENG/EFP news gathering and the headphones are just excellent. The Headphones fold into a neat and compact bag for packing and storing.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: To be fair, I have only limited experience with this type of headphone. The sound quality, noise blocker and headphone manipulation are excellent. I was also expecting unquestionable comfort but it is uncomfortable to sit through an entire movie. I need to remove these headphones every 30 minutes or so because it begins to feel like my ears are lossing circulation and get in pain. I fear that if I was a ConeHead, I'd have to remove them every 5 minutes or so. I haven't owned them long enought to comment on durability.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphones rock, I bought them after my bose AE were stolen and I am much happier with them overall. At only [$], these are well worth every penny. They are on par, if not better in sound quality over the bose that I had. The cable is only attached at one side, which makes for putting the headphones on and taking them off easier. Also, the cable is curled so you will not have a problem with tangled, knotted, or kinked cables anymore. Overall, the sound quality is awesome, the build is sturdy, they fold up easily for portability, and the cord is user friendly.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Having recently been moved out of my private office into a cubicle, I needed a decent pair of 'phones so that I could listen to music without disturbing anyone, and so that I could filter out all the ambient noise. I was going to be wearing 'em all day long, so they needed to be really comfortable for long periods of time, and they needed to be durable enough to stand up to all-day,every-day use. These seem to do the trick; whenever my coworker starts bouncing his stupid soccer ball on the floor, I put these on and drown him out with music. The noise suppression is satisfactory, though you really need to play something moderately loud if you want to fully mask outside noises. However, sound doesn't seem to leak out from the headphones hardly at all. Sound quality is excellent! The bu ... ild quality is exceptional, and I think they should last me quite a while. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: A Good Mix of Comfort and Sound Quality
Item.Review: Primarily used with an iPod 160 while listening to heavy metal (mostly), original soundtracks/scores, classical music and rock. The design is old-fashioned, but still looks nice. Very comfortable cushions, especially around the ears. Cord is rather long and feels half as heavy as the headset itself, but looks very well built. This set is clearly meant for stationary and studio use (not for walks, exercise or outdoor travel). Sound quality is good, if not great, though it might take a couple days for the balance to begin kicking in. That said, there still seems to be an imbalance of the range, namely with regards to how prominent the highs are. If you listen to fast and/or high-pitch music, then this will likely give you better quality than most headsets. But if you have lower-tuned ... music or have a strong amount of variety, then it might be a bit troublesome. Overall, however, this is a solid headset that's easy to recommend simply thanks to the overall good sound quality and wonderful comfort (especially given the price). expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Quality built. Excellent sound quality. I personally love the long cable. It makes my live so much easier when for some reason my zoom h4 recorder has to be placed away from the camera.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Bought for commuting by bus and when I need a break at home to crank the tunes. Great sound, but I haven't tried many others at this level or better. The descripton doesn't show how they fold. I was hoping the would rotate and lay flat so you could fit them in a day pack or brief case, but no such luck (they fold inward) to form a ball. Over the ear is a great way to go. My previous Sony one's were on ear types and not nearly as comfortable nor reduced outside as much as these. They run off my ipod, but don't know for how long.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphones are a very great value. I use them for personal monitoring for recording and playback off of my computer. The best part about it was that they are very comfortable. I wear glasses and most headphones out there cause a lot of ear fatigue and puts pressure on your temples. But, these are set up nicely to avoid the pain of wearing glasses with them. The frequency range is very wide so there are a lot of nuances that you will hear in your mixes. The frequency response opens up at about 50 hours of use, the highs and lows become more clear once you break them in. So don't judge till you give them a few days to break in. The only problem I had was that the travel bag it comes with is pretty floppy and not that great at protecting them in case you are nomadic like I am. There is ... a little bit of bleed coming from them, even though they are closed back. So high volumes will come across the mic into your recording. Which is inevitable with most headphones. All in all, these are some great headphones. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I'm a media and film student and needed good headphones for editing audio/film. These work wonderfully... though I'm not totally sure whether its because they actually are exceptional or because of my lack of experience with studio quality headphones. I've had them for a few months now and have had no problems but I have had concerns that maybe they aren't as solid/durable as they should be? not that they have actually broken just that the joints seem a little wobbly?

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphnes are awesome. They provide great sound quality, a long but managable cord, and can fold up nicely and fit into the bag for a relatively easy travel experience. I got them to use with my home audio equipment, along with travel use on my laptop. If you are looking for something to travel with, there may be better options, seeing as even if you fold it up, if you have a small bag, it may not fit. I havent had any trouble yet though, so just do a little research before buying. The one con I have to add is that they get a little uncomfterable after wearing them for a couple hours, and I need to take them off for a few minutes. They make replacement ear pads, and I'm confident those would do nicely.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use this headphone while editing and mixing. It does a greater job than it's cost. Ear pads are very comportable, I have no problem wearing avg of 3hrs. Although it is not a greatese headphone, it catches most of the pitches. If it is going to be used on studio for editing and mixing, then I highly recommend it!

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphones are really good, especially considering the price range. If you're kind of deciding whether or not to get them, I would definitely recommend buying them. There hasn't been a day yet were they haven't been on my head.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: After owning a pair of these for over 20 years, it was time to order a new pair. I stepped on them and broke one of the ear pieces. However, It was time anyway. The new ones sound amazing. Even better then the old set. One of the best Headphones for your studio or everyday music.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Excellent sound for a fair price
Item.Review: I listen a lot to acoustic/instrumental music (i.e. Dolly Parton, Johnny Cash, The Cardigans) with not so heavy bass and these headphones gives me excellent sound for the fair price. Clear sound, you hear every sound perfect. Highly recommended.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I originally bought these, since I'm a Sony fan, and I was disappointed. The SQ was flat, and they seriously lacked bass of any kind. I didn't realize that these were reference headphones, and that they don't exaggerate any of the sound frequencies as other headphones do. I decided to burn them in a bit, listening to them while doing so, and what a surprise it was. Now, the sound staging is amazing, I can hear little hidden areas of the tracks that were never noticed before, and I've discovered that music doesn't always need to be booming to sound great. All in all, a wonderful set of HP's. I will recommend getting another set of ear pads though, as the current ones tend to make my ears sweat profusely. If you can manage to locate a set of Beyerdynamic Velour Padded Earcushions for DT250 h ... p's, grab them. They really add to the excellence of the MDR-V6 HP's. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use this Sony V6 with my H4N. It is very comfortable to wear hours and hours. It is very easy to store too. It is foldable and there is a leather case come with it. I can even put my V6 in my camera bag. One more thing is good quility.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I bought these to replace my old worn 7506 headphones that have been used daily for years. So far so good. They sound and feel the same to me. I won't know for a few years if they will withstand the test of time but so far so good.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Very High Fidelity
Cons: Zero
Purchased in 1985 and still to this day are the best headphones I've personally experienced, and that list is long. You need not look any further for wonderful sound.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These are a great pair of headphones that I would definitely buy again. They are very comfortable, sound great, sit on my head without sliding off while moving around, and block out a good bit of noise as well. Great buy!

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I bought these headphones to do professional field audio. For the price they sound great and are well made except for one problem. The soft ear covers will not stay on the headphones. I must have put the covers back on the headphones at least five times on one shoot. Once I got home I selectively spot super glued the covers on. I have done three shoots since and they have not fallen off once.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I read the other reviews about how good this was relative to much higher priced headpohones, which I had. Now I wear these exclusively, and a friend who is serious music told me the next version up was considered the studio headphone of choice. The sound is unbelievably clear and accurate.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Amazing Sound Quality,Comfortable,Great Durability
Cons: None
I've read many reviews about the earcups wearing off, but having had this pair of headphones for 5 months, that hasn't happened yet. The sound quality is amazing and makes even some of the not-so-nice songs actually sound decent. I've tossed these headphones around a billion times and dropped them a couple times. but the quality still remains great. I expect these to last at least several more years.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: The Sony MDR-V6 are a great set of headphones. I had used them years ago, switch to Bose and now I'm glad I switched back to Sony. They've got an excellent sound and a great feel to them. I wish they had included an extra set of foam covers, that's the first thing that goes. I was tempted to buy a set of Shures, just for that.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: OK, The MDR V6 is an Excellent headphone and BHPhotovideo.com offered the best price I could find. The quality is superb, remember these headphones were introduced in 1985 as studio monitor headphones and Sony are still producing them today so they also maintian the original look/design. You wont be dissapointed - these headphones could have easily been priced at [$]. Excellent clear sound. Buy from BHPhotovideo.com and Enjoy. Cheers.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I am in charge of purchasing equipment for a film program and these headphones are quite good for the price. The amount of abuse they take from all of our students is impressive. They do fall apart after some time, but if you take good care of them, they will last quite a long time.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: I would buy this product again !!
Item.Review: The sounds is so clear, and seems so natural. The output is also very well balanced to my ear (no required to make any adjustment to either the bass, treble or mid range of the player). I am so glad it works better than than my old MDR-V1, which is also great.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable Fit,Easy To Drive,Folds Up,Heavy Duty Cable,Metal Housing,Near Perfect Audio Reproduction
Cons: I Didnt Buy These Earlier In My Life.
These are quite frankly the best headphones I've ever heard!. 1:) First glance- the packaging is so nicely done, the headphones are cradled in this red cloth, that really compliments the headphones sitting in their box. I've NEVER seen something like this in headphones, even in my AKG K701, which cost a heckuva lot more.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use these to track guitar and listen for very minor details when mixing. They excel at both tasks. The sound is very clear and very flat (as far as I can tell).

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I've been making beats for about 3 years and I needed a pair of headphones that played clean and crisp audio and had the right quality sound, these headphones reproduce perfect frequencies and give you an accurate feedback. Great buy

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I you the product for listening to audio and soundtrack files for school and work. No sound difference between speakers and Headphones on playback. Yet you can hear the small differences in different compressed audio files.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use these with a portable pro audio mixing rig and as a camera headphone. Great sound for such a compact headphone, comfortable, cheap, well-built. Earphone pads slip off sometimes. A no-brainer purchase for a headphone of this quality.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound Quility And Comfortable
Cons: Earcups Wore Out
I was very pleased with these headphones until the ear cups wore out. The black liners began ripping off the form.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use these headphones at my computer for all my needs at home and at work. These headphones are solid and have a rich sound that are hard to get at this price. What I mean by classics is that they have been around for along time. These V6's are pretty under the radar and low priced but don't let that fool you. The are very comfortable too. Totally worth it. I have a pair of Bose around ear headphones and they are good too, but two times the price, and they don't have the comfy feel of the V-6's.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These Sony MDR-V6 Headphones are used for critical listening sessions and editing of custom recordings. The sound is clear and un-encumbered, without any coloration of the sound tracks. No matter what type of music you like or use these phones for, you will not be sorry. Be advised not all Sony models are this good, so do not be misled and purchase another model. Extremely comfortable for long sessions, fold compactly for travel or storage. Only down side I can think of is they are not as compact as earbud styles. But, earbuds are not for this type of listening. Very similar to MDR-7506 professional model, also excellent. Highly recommended!

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: One of the best closed headphones in the price range. Although open headphones obviously have better sound quality, I usually use these in more quiet places, and they do extremely well.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I love the way the sound feels like it's coming from the top of your head/centered, instead of left/right ears. That to me is a mark of good stero. No need to get technical...for the money this is a great product.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: They get the job done and don't break
Item.Review: I like these because they do not have a bunch of plastic parts that break at the wrong times when I'm in the field recording audio. I wish there were a way to make a cord less bothersome, but until these are wireless, that's not going to happen. Great phones if you are a field person who puts hard use on your equipment.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Great first set of real headphones
Item.Review: I use this product with MacBook Pros, iPhones and for Xbox gaming. These headphones are great for long periods of continued use. I cant think of anything wrong with them. Great purchase!

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: This headphone came out in the 80's I believe, and it's still considered people's favourite headphones (upon researching reviews).[...] I can't be happier. They are comfortable, the price is decent too, and being closed headphones they drain out useless noise. I'm no audiophile expert but I have high expectations for headphones and I'm more than happy. The plug is well built, plus the collapsable feature is definitely a bonus for transporting. It pinches when you wear it around your neck, but the collapsing really helps when transporting. A little tight, and can get uncomfortable with glasses on.But overall, great cans.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I've had these headphones for ages now and finally changed the ear pads out. Not sure why i waited so long to change them out but it had made them comfortable to wear for hours at a time. Before with the Old Stock pads i would start to have ear pain after just 20 minutes of use. Dang i love these headphones even after 15+ years of use.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Sony, as always, delivers a quality product. Great sound, flexible 10' cable, nice folding design. Unfortunately I don't feel comfortable to wear it for a long time but maybe its just me.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use these headphones in the field to ensure that I am capturing good quality audio on my Canon Vixia HV30 videocamera. This has saved my bacon on more than one occasion--alerting me, for example, that my shotgun mic was not on (the mic lacks a power on light, and the switch is extremely tiny). Because connecting this mic disables the on-board mic, I would have ended up with no audio on the tape--but for the MDR-V6. The circumaural design blocks out ambient noise quite well. The audio quality of these 'phones is very good for music listening. The 10' cable has been remarkably helpful for times when I had to move away from the camera after setting it up--for example, to hold up a reflector. I also appreciated getting a free mini-to-standard phono plug adaptor. All in all, an excellent prod ... uct and good value for money. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use these everyday. They are super comfortable and i forget that i have them on at times. The only thing i see that can be improved is the headband doesn't stay clicked on the number notches all the time, causing the need to readjust them when putting them on for the first time again

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: am very pleased with Sony MDR-V6 Professional Stereo Headphones. They have met all of my criteria nicely; they cost under $100.00 (got them cheap at http://www.bhphotovideo.com [...]); they are light weight, and; they reproduce sound across the entire musical range (10Hz - 20,000Hz). An added bonus: they fold up nicely so that I can take them with me on those rare occasions when I travel with my laptop. And Sony provided me with a handy soft pouch in which to place the headphone. They are not in the same range as Bose but quality costs.I can't think of one negative thing to say about the headphones, they are just that good. The Sony MDR-V6 Professional Stereo Headphones are clear winners. ?? less???

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: My search for headphones started with an ambition for to find the best noise cancelling headphones. I ultimately found that they were 1. bose qc15, 2. bose qc33. sony MDR-NC500Din the process of this search, I found the MDR-v6's at a sony store. the salesman informed me that these are the music industry standard. they retail for $110, b&h hand them for [$] and the sound quality beats all 3 of the above listed $300+ headphones (granted, you lose noise cancelling). these headphones are a steal. stop reading and just buy them. you won't regret it.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Most headphones are designed to make music sound good. These seem to be designed to help an audio guy hear problems -- exactly what I needed! I use them with a variety of mics for my camera during interviews and whenever I'm really concerned about levels and distracting ambient noise. They'll pick up whispers of wind noise that other, much more expensive headphones don't reproduce well. In fact, they're great because I can detect noise I don't want to record, and I reshoot instead of correcting in post. Comfy and accurate are words that describe them best. However I loaned them to my sister, a concert pianist, who hated them because they didn't blend the attacks and decays to make her music sound smooth. Decent cable length and one-sided wiring are helpful in the field, too. I've us ... ed quite a few different brands, and this one seems to provide the crispest sound. I really like them while shooting and editing. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: These Are Older Than I Am
Item.Review: These headphones were purchased secondhand by my parents sometime shortly after they came to the US in '85. I was born in '90, and I am currently listening to them right now. They have traveled around the world several times worth, to 4 continents, used in sub-freezing temperatures to and from class, to hot, sweaty clubs when doing live sound for shows. They have been thrown across studios, dragged through hallways, and have lulled me to sleep nearly every night for the last 8 or so years. And they still sound as good as they did the first time my dad let me put them on. After several earpad replacements, I eventually settled with a custom modified set, which has held up much better than the stock pads, which flake and get all over the place. At this rate, I expect to be buried with this p ... air when I die. They will probably outlast me, considering what they have been put through. And I believe they'll sound just as good as they did when I first got it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Very honest sound. I use these for tracking acoustic guitar and every sound, good and bad, comes through clearly. I've used many different headphones for this purpose over the years, and these are by far the best. These headphones are indispensable for both home and pro studios. I don't know if I'd recommend them for casual listening. Digital artifacts, background hiss, etc., become very apparent through these headphones. That's what makes them so great for the studio. I will also add that the build quality of this product is superior to any headphone under $150. Get them before Sony quits making them.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: The 90% I'm delighted with are: The fantastic sound quality, comfortable luxurious feel, weight (not too heavy), fit (snug but not tight), and the well designed plug. Let me explain further - I traveled to every retail store in the city that had headphones I could try on before I made my selection; and read all the reviews on [@]and bought these. The sound quality equaled the quality of Bose for about 30% less money. They are very comfortable and can be used for extended periods of time with no regrets. Just so you'll know, I'm 55, 6'1 tall at 260lbs so my head is probably larger than some. I use the headphones exclusively for listening to music on my new Onkyo stereo receiver. Music I listen to is: loud blearing rock, light classical, mp3 recordings from the Music Choice channels on TV, J ... azz, Country, and Classic Rock. Where I noticed the fine quality of these headphones the most is listening to music I loved 30 years ago that now seems to have instruments that I was never was able to hear before. Having LOUD volume with CLEAR RICH (not just clear) sound are two areas these headphones excel at. At very loud volumes I could hear no distortion or anything that would make me squirm, flinch, or want to take them off. OK, now the 10% I'm not delighted with - first and foremost...they don't have any volume controls which I truly miss from the old days. The only other thing is the coily cord is squirrelly for the first 18 after it comes out of the headphones - looks like a coiled cord somebody stretched to try to make it straight. If you are ok with headphones that cover your ears and don't mind the price and the two points above - you will absolutely LOVE these headphones. [...] expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: use for listening to music and for amateur home music recording. great tone and volume. my ears get a little hot, but I'm not sure how to not have that happen. I'm not sure how much better headphones can get by spending more... these seem to be pretty amazing.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphones are great! They are almost identical to the MDR-7506 sound wise and appearance wise. You might as well save some money and go with these since they sound very similar. I love the coiled cord too. I use these when editing short films as well as when I am being a boom operator on films.

Item.Item: Sony MDR V6 - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Looking for low dollar and high-quality?
Item.Review: I can hear every tiny nuance of my music with these. The frequency response is out of this world and the bass is extremely tight, even with a bass boost on my PC's EQ. I often find myself going through my playlist and listening to my music just to enjoy how perfect these sound. Cymbals sound like cymbals and aren't tinny at all -- vocals sound like you're standing in front of the person listening to them -- bass sounds deep and solid. I challenge anyone to find headphones that sound better in the same price range; to 90% of the ears out there, these will sound like professional, studio-quality headphones. They sure sound as close to perfect as perfect can get to me. --HIGHLY recommend buying the Beyerdynamic velour ear cushions to increase comfort and bass response significantly; ... read my review on there about them. expand » « collapse
